text pasusa 1 stanley:
The Stanley Tools brand has a long-standing tradition in the hand tool industry.

The Stanley Works was founded by Frederick Trent Stanley in 1843 in New Britain, Connecticut, originally as a manufacturer of door bolts and hardware.

Another company, The Stanley Rule and Level, was founded by his cousin, Henry Stanley, in 1857, also in New Britain.

In 1920, the two companies merged, and the hand tool division continued to operate under The Stanley Works.

This merger laid the foundation for the development of Stanley hand tools, which would later become a symbol of reliability and precision in the carpentry and construction industries.

Around 1937, Stanley acquired the British company J. A. Chapman, a well-known manufacturer of woodworking tools from Sheffield.

This acquisition helped Stanley expand into the UK market and solidify its global presence.

In March 2010, Stanley Works merged with Black & Decker to form the global corporation Stanley Black & Decker.

Today, Stanley Hand Tools continues to evolve as a key brand within this group, staying true to its roots while meeting the needs of modern tool users.
text pasusa 2 stanley:
Stanley is known for many innovations that have improved tool performance and efficiency.

Some of the most famous innovations include the Bailey plane, Surform tool, PowerLock tape measure, utility knife, and the versatile Stanley #1 Odd Jobs tool.

The Stanley FatMax line stands out for its heavy-duty tools designed to endure the toughest working conditions.

These tools are highly favored by professionals for their durability and reliability.
text pasusa 3 stanley:
Stanley offers a broad range of hand tools for various applications, including woodworking, metalworking, and measurement.

Some of the most recognized products include hand planes, saws, rulers, squares, chisels, screwdrivers, and a variety of other tools for both personal and commercial use.

For woodworking, Stanley provides precise saws, chisels, and measuring tools that ensure controlled cuts and accurate shaping.

Their tape measures and levels, especially those in the FatMax line, deliver accurate readings even in challenging work environments.

In the metalworking category, Stanley manufactures efficient shears, files, and other finishing tools that enable precise results.

Stanley tools are a trusted choice for professionals and hobbyists around the globe.
